How to Install ruby-sshkit on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • ruby-sshkit

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install ruby-sshkit on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing ruby-sshkit on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall ruby-sshkit in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install ruby-sshkit, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install ruby-sshkit Using apt

To install ruby-sshkit in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install ruby-sshkit using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install ruby-sshkit

The installation of ruby-sshkit might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install ruby-sshkit Using apt-get

To install ruby-sshkit using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install ruby-sshkit.

sudo apt-get -y install ruby-sshkit

Install ruby-sshkit Using Synaptic

To install ruby-sshkit using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install ruby-sshkit on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for ruby-sshkit. This will display the ruby-sshkit package in the package window, now to install ruby-sshkit, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the ruby-sshkit package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of ruby-sshkit.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install ruby-sshkit Using aptitude

To install ruby-sshkit on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of ruby-sshkit.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install ruby-sshkit using the command aptitude install ruby-sshkit.

sudo aptitude -y install ruby-sshkit

How to Upgrade ruby-sshkit on debian

If you want to upgrade the ruby-sshkit package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade ruby-sshkit using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade ruby-sshkit to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade ruby-sshkit.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade ruby-sshkit sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade ruby-sshkit

Upgrade ruby-sshkit using Aptitude

To upgrade ruby-sshkit using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade ruby-sshkit.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade ruby-sshkit

Upgrade ruby-sshkit using Synaptic

To upgrade ruby-sshkit using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for ruby-sshkit, now right-click ruby-sshkit, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade ruby-sshkit just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall ruby-sshkit on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall ruby-sshkit from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just ruby-sshkit, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove ruby-sshkit

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of ruby-sshkit

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of ruby-sshkit you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge ruby-sshkit

Remove ruby-sshkit using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall ruby-sshkit using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for ruby-sshkit, right-click the ruby-sshkit package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall ruby-sshkit click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install ruby-sshkit on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade ruby-sshkit using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of ruby-sshkit then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
